commitResults.messageTitle: Update AboutUs document for chloeelim - add skeletal PPP - add image and roles/ responsibilities

commitResults.messageBody: Removes instances of AddressBook in README, updates it to ArtBuddy.
- Add `additer` and `deliter` use cases
- Add `additer` and `deliter` commands
- Minor changes to DG based on feedback
- Updates User Guide Command Summary with missing ArtBuddy commands

Styles the tab headers according to the UI mockup- changes the
tab background and border radius. Also styles the tabs when they
are selected/ unselected.

commitResults.messageTitle: Ui: fix card pane styling issue
commitResults.messageBody: Removes the whitespace between the tab and card pane.

Makes the customer details pane
- correct colour
- with rounded borders
- with padding
Updates background to match with mockup colour scheme.

commitResults.messageTitle: Ui: update ListViews and rename window
commitResults.messageBody:
Updates the CustomerListPanel and CommissionListPanel according
to mockup and renames window to ArtBuddy.

Fixes the result display having white edges, as well as its scroll bar
(when the result is too long- horizontal and vertical scroll bars are
being shown) having a weird white square at the corner.

Adds the Iteration class with the following attributes:
- date
- description
- feedback

Iterations also should have an image/ art attribute tied to it,
but this attribute will be added in a later commission due to the
associated complexities.

Adds `UniqueIterationList`, which is a list of iterations whose uniqueness
are enforced. Also adds an `UniqueIterationList` to each commission.

Currently, uniqueness of iterations in the `UniqueIterationList` are
determined by their description, however, this probably should be
changed to the art/ image (filepath) once that has been implemented.

Extends functionality of the Storage component to also store iterations by
- adding `JsonAdaptedIteration` for iterations, a Jackson-friendly version of `Iteration`
- modifying `JsonAdaptedCommission` to also store iterations

commitResults.messageTitle: Model: Set the active commission to the first commission
commitResults.messageBody:
Temporarily sets the active commission to the first commission
to test the implementation of the iterations.

Note to the implementer of `opencom` to revert this change
when implementing the `opencom` command.

Adds the GUI for commissions
- Enable tracking of the 'active' Commission in the `ModelManager`
- Adds `CommissionDetailsPane` to show the details of the selected commission
- Updates GUI to change commission pane to show the 'current' commission when
a commission card is clicked

Implementation note: This implementation would currently reset the selected
commission everytime a customer is selected. This design choice was undertaken
so that when a different customer is selected, the commission detail pane will
not show the previous commission belonging to the previous selected customer.
Adds `IterationListItem` UI component to display iterations.

Adds the `additer` command which requires a date(`/n`), description (`/d`),
and feedback (`/f`) tag currently. Future implementations might want to look
into making some of these fields (eg: feedback) optional.

Adds the `deliter` command which provides the functionality to delete the
iteration at the specified index of the active commission.

Makes the `CommissionDetailsPane` scrollable to accomodate to the height
of the details pane.

commitResults.messageTitle: UI: make GUI update each time iterations are modified
commitResults.messageBody:
Makes the GUI responsive to modifications of iterations (ie: `additer` to
add iteration, `deliter` to delete iteration). This is achieved by
rendering the iterations in a `ListView` instead so that the GUI is
re-rendered each time the `ObservableList` of iterations in the `Commission`
is modified.

`UniqueIterationList` wrongly throws a `DuplicateCommissionException`,
this commit fixes the exception by throwing a `DuplicationIterationException`
instead.

`ParserUtil#parseTitle` was wrongly throwing a `ParseException` with
exception message for `Phone` constraints. As as result, when you
enter an `addcom` command with an invalid title (one that contains
non-alphumerical characters like punctuation), the result displays
"Phone numbers should only contain numbers, and it should be at
least 3 digits long". This commit fixes this bug.

Updates the iteration list GUI in the `CommissionDetailsPane` by

- Fixing the bug whereby the iteration list is not cleared when
no commission is seleted (ie: the iteration list of the previously
selected commission continues to show even after changing customer,
and no commission is presently selected). This bug is due to the
`ListView` not being set to `null` when no commission is selected.

- Improving the GUI by displaying the iteration details more
neatly in the `IterationListItem`. Now, the Iteration index,
`Description`, and `Date` will be aligned in a single row
at the top of the `IterationListItem`. The `Description` field
will also scale according to the window size while the other two
fields remain fixed. A minor problem that has not been fixed yet
is that for very long description names, the description will be
eclipsed (...).

Future improvements should look into scaling this
height-wise to show the full description (or impose a character cap).
Note that this issue is also present for other labels in AB (like
Commission title).

- This commit also enforces a minimum width (equal to the `CustomerListPanel`
or `CommissionListPanel`) to the `CustomerDetailsPane` and `CommissionDetailsPane`
to reduce the pain with having to deal with alignment issues in `IterationListItem`
when resizing the panes.

commitResults.messageTitle: UI: add placeholder art image to `IterationListItem`
commitResults.messageBody:
Adds a placeholder art image to `IterationListItem`, to be replaced
with the actual art image of the iteration once the implementation
for the image in iteration has been finalised.

Styles the `IterationListItem` art image and feedback so that they
are now aligned and have proper margins. Also styles the label texts
for `Description`, `Date`, and the index id of the `IterationListItem`.

Makes the `Description` and `Feedback` field of the `IterationListItem`
not truncate and scale in height based on the text length to
accomodate for very long Descriptions or Feedbacks.

commitResults.messageTitle: UI: add display message when no Iterations
commitResults.messageBody:
Adds a label to display that no iterations are found for commissions
with no iterations.

Updates the UI for `CustomerDetailsPane` and `CommissionDetailsPane`
to make sure that all possibly long text labels are now responsive
and will not truncate the texts.

Also updates the CSS styling so that they both use the same CSS
style class for uniformity.

commitResults.messageTitle: UI: revert responsive text labels for `CustomerListPanel`
commitResults.messageBody:
Removes reponsive text labels for the Customer cards in
`CustomerListPanel`. Also adds proper margins for the
`CommissionDetailsPanel`.

Updates the `CommissionDetailsPane` by
- Adding the field icons to the attributes (Deadline, Customer and Fee)
- Makes the CompletionStatus more meaningful by adding a method to
translate that into more 'meaningful' terms ("Completed", "In Progress",
and "Not Started") based on the `CompletionStatus` and number of Iterations
in the Commission.

In order to achieve this, these new methods/ enums were added:
- Enum `CompletionStatusString` which has all the valid CompletionStatusStrings
used to render the more 'meaningful' completion statuses
- `Commission#getCompletionStatusString` which computes the CompletionStatusString
based on its CompletionStatus (if completed, "Completed"), and the number of
iterations (0: "Not Started", >0: "In Progress")
- To support this, a `size` method was also created in `UniqueIterationList`
to retrieve the number of iterations stored in the `UniqueIterationList`

As the `updateUI` method in `CommissionDetailsPane` is getting lengthy,
let's also abstract out the methods called.

In particular, abstracting the `updateProgressComponent` allows us to call the
same method to refresh the Progress component of the `CommissionDetailsPane`
every time its `UniqueIterationList` is updated (due to adding of a new Iteration,
or deletion of an existing Iteration)- which is needed because the progress status
also depends on the number of Iterations in the `UniqueIterationList`.

Fixes the alignment of the placeholder box ("No Iterations Found")
when viewed on wider screens.

Adds back the 'Iterations' header accidentally deleted when merging
the iterations GUI and commissions GUI PR.

commitResults.messageTitle: UI: refactor customer and commission tag styling
commitResults.messageBody:
Refactors out the styling (different background color) for Customer
and Commission tags by abstracting it out into their own separate
CSS class instead rather than adding the styles from JavaFx.

This also updates the `CommissionDetailsPane` tags so that their
tags background colours match that of the `CommissionCard`.

commitResults.messageTitle: UI: set min height to iterationsList
commitResults.messageBody:
Sets a minimum height to iterationsList in `CommissionDetailsPane`
to ensure that you can still properly see all iterations even if
the Commission details are very lengthy.

commitResults.messageTitle: UI: update Customer and Commission cards
commitResults.messageBody:
Updates the Customer and Commission cards in the `CustomerListPanel`
and `CommissionListPanel` by styling the titles and adding proper paddings
and margins. Also removes some (secondary) details from the cards
such as address (for customer) and description for commission).

Updates Commission Card, however noticed some lagging issues- will
look into trying to resolve that in later commits.

Fixes the buggy `CommissionDetailsPane`, noticed that the `updateProgressComponents`
method was not working properly (to replicate, go to a commission that is 'not started'
and add an iteration, you'll notice that the status changed to 'completed'- assumming
the first commission of AB is completed).

This is because `CommissionDetailsPane` stores the first commission that the
`ObservableObject` used to initialise it stores (ie: the first commission
in AB).

Because the `updateProgressComponents` method tries to get the
`completionStatusString` from this stored object, it erronously gets the wrong
completionStatusString during an **iterationList update** (not the commission update),
it'd update the completionStatusString erronously (to the first commission).

This commit fixes this bug by storing the `ObservableObject` instead.

Fixes bug whereby window resizing does not cause 'completion status'
in the commission card to be stickied to the right.

commitResults.messageTitle: UI: remove fee and deadline from commission card
commitResults.messageBody:
Removes the fee and deadline display from the commission card
to reduce lag experienced.

Shape nodes don't seem to work well in `ListView`s, causing the
UI to be really jumpy- substituting the Shape with an empty
Label and styling it to mimic a Circle seems to do the trick
albeit seemingly a dumb solution.

commitResults.messageTitle: UI: add deadline to Commissions card
commitResults.messageBody:
Adds deadline to Commission card display as well as fixes some
alignment issues.

Fix the progress updating in the Commissions card and CommissionDetailsPane
by making it listen to its iteration list for updates properly.

commitResults.messageTitle: UI: fix alignment issues in header
commitResults.messageBody:
Fixes alignment issues in Commissions Card header between index
and title.
Styles the description field of `CommissionDetailsPane`.
Fixes NullExceptionPointer possibly thrown by updateProgress.

commitResults.messageTitle: UI: change selected ListView during open commands
commitResults.messageBody:
Makes the UI selected ListView item change (highlighted)
when `opencus` and `opencomm` commands are made.

Fixes code quality issues in the UI- default branch should throw
an Exception, and remove instances of 'magic values'.
Final class-level constants that are associated should have a common prefix.

Adds `IterationBuilder` and `TypicalIterations` class to use for
for testing Iterations.

Refactors `ModelStub` out from `AddCustomerCommandTest` so that other add commands
can also implement the `ModelStub` for testing.
Also creates a Commission stub to test the `AddIterationCommand`.
Adds testcases for the DeleteIterationCommand.

commitResults.messageTitle: Test: fix equals test for `AddIterationCommand` and `DeleteIterationCommand`
commitResults.messageBody: Use `assertFalse` instead.
Adds integration tests for `AddIterationCommand` and `DeleteIterationCommand`.
Adds testcases for `Iteration`.
Adds testcases to test the methods of `UniqueIterationList`.
Note that testing has not been done for images.
Fixes checkstyle issues causing CI to fail.

Enforces the constraint that ArtBuddy Commission fees cannot be more
than $10,000,000. Else, there might be some unexpected behaviours (eg:
Commissions with $Inifinity fee).
Currently if the data/images file is not there, the app fails.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix: remove instance of pokemon exception handling
commitResults.messageBody:
Makes the copying of image to the data/images folder throw a CommandException
instead of printing the stack trace.

Removes redundant important and updates the example command for
`additer` to include file paths.
Adds iteration Feedback testcases.
Adds iteration date test cases.
Adds Iteration ImagePath testcases.

Adds test cases for `AddIterationComamndParser`. Also modifies
previous testcases to use actual test images so that the test cases
will not fail when trying to parse the image paths.
Adds testcases for `DeleteIterationCommandParser`.
Use better variable names.

Use better variable naming

Co-authored-by: seelengxd <34371483+seelengxd@users.noreply.github.com>
Adds an 'Add Commission' button to the CommissionListPanel.

commitResults.messageTitle: Feat: add basic functionality for addcom by GUI
commitResults.messageBody:
Adds a new control bar for the CommissionListPanel,
adds a new window to add commission details,
adds functionality to allow users to add commissions from the new window.

To do: refactor code and improve code quality, support addition of tags.

Allows creation of tags by GUI, enforces max number of tags
and tag name length due to ui issues for very long tag names/ many tags.
Allows tags in AddCommissionWindow to be deleted.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix: add commission gui description field
commitResults.messageBody: Changes the description textarea into a textfield (no newline chars).

commitResults.messageTitle: Feat: Add Customer Window and addcus by GUI
commitResults.messageBody:
Adds the abstract CustomerWindow that the AddCustomerWindow inherits from,
and that EditCustomerWindow will inherit from later. GUI now supports `addcus`
by GUI (without support for tags).

To look into abstracting out the CommissionWindow for AddCommissionWindow,
and perhaps even abstracting them out further into CommandWindows as
they share several similar commands.

Enforces a char count cap of 25 chars for tag names to avoid issues
with render the tag ui.
Add information about `additer` command.
Co-authored-by: seelengxd <34371483+seelengxd@users.noreply.github.com>

commitResults.messageTitle: UI: Remove max number of tag constraint
commitResults.messageBody:
Removes the constraint that only up to 10 tags can be added
to a commission when adding a commission by the GUI by
putting the `FlowPane` in a `ScrollPane`..

Refactor out error message display and tag fields in
the command windows.

commitResults.messageTitle: Feat: support addcus tags by GUI
commitResults.messageBody:
Adds support for adding and deleting tags for customers in the add customer
GUI window.
Fixes adding commissions by GUI (description can be optional).

Refactors the commission window into its own class that `AddCommissionWindow`
inherits from so that adding a `EditCommissionWindow` will be easier.
Adds iteration window from which the `AddIterationWindow` inherits from.

AB throws a `NullPointerException` when creating an iteration
and giving a blank image path as it is not currently handling
the case where the given file at the specified filepath cannot be
determined (in which case `Files.probeContentType` returns null).

Let's include a null check to handle this.

Adds functionality to select images from file browser in
`IterationWindow`.
Fixes image upload error.

commitResults.messageTitle: Feat: Allow drag and drop image upload
commitResults.messageBody:
Allows drag and drop image upload in the iteration window. Will
only accept the first valid image uploaded (if it exists).
Styles the upload image drop box.

commitResults.messageTitle: UI: fix issues with other os
commitResults.messageBody:
Window content may appear chopped off for certain other OS, not
very sure why- but to be safe, let's increase the height of the
CustomerWindow and also put the content of the windows inside
a scrollpane so the window becomes scrollable instead of getting
cut off.

commitResults.messageTitle: UI: make image preview scale proportionately
commitResults.messageBody:
Makes the image preview scale proportionately to the image proportions instead
of force-fitting to a set width/ height.

commitResults.messageTitle: UI: change to toggle button input control
commitResults.messageBody: Uses a toggle button instead of textfield for completion status input in CommissionWindow.
Adds `edititer` command support to edit iterations.
Adds test cases to test `EditIterationCommand`.
Adds testcases for `EditIterationCommandParser`.

Removes customer label from the CommissionDetailsPane. (Buggy when
customer is edited, should look into removing the reference to Customer
in Commission entirely?)
Fixes spacing for `CustomerDetailsPane` and tabs.

Removes id label from Customer and Commission details pane
because it is not in use, and makes the image sizes bigger
in iteration list item.

Adds option menu button with GUI edit/ delete menu items. Also
fixes spacing in iteration list item.

I give up- edit/ delete by GUI is going to be a whole headache because
you need the index (deleting by reference is possible, but that's going to
require either some refactoring or code duplication with the possibility
of some referencing screwing up somewhere)- overall it isn't worth it and
probably will introduce more bugs.
Forces it to be scrollable only vertically-wise.

commitResults.messageTitle: UI: fix bordering issues and statusbar
commitResults.messageBody: Fixes the border lines showing for the pane tab, and the status bar color.
Co-authored-by: seelengxd <34371483+seelengxd@users.noreply.github.com>
Sets the default window size.

Try to hardcode the dimensions of the fields to fix the issue
with the UI appearing differently across different OS.

commitResults.messageTitle: UI: Make error display full height
commitResults.messageBody:
Makes the error display full height to see the full error message
inside the add command windows.

Handles no image selected in iteration add GUI with a more appropriate
error message.

commitResults.messageBody: Adds the class diagram for Iterations.
Finish up the documentation for `additer`.

commitResults.messageBody: Adds basic styling for stats in Customer commission pane.
Makes the customer details pane scrollable to accomodate stats.
Adds piechart to display breakdown of commission completion status.
Refactors code by abstracting out the update ui methods in the customer details pane.
Adds tooltips to the pie chart.

Adds commission class and its following attributes:
- deadline (LocalDate)
- Fee (double)

A person can have many commissions. Thus, create a
UniqueCommissionList (referenced from UniquePersonList).

commitResults.messageTitle: Model: track activePerson instead of commissions
commitResults.messageBody:
Ran into problems with pass by value - updating UniqueCommissionList (UCL)
in AddressBook was not updating the UCL of the person.

Let's store the person instead and operate on the person's UCL directly.

commitResults.messageTitle: Model: temporarily set first customer as active
commitResults.messageBody:
BREAKING CHANGE: if there are no customers, this will throw an error.

This should be reverted when command `opencus` is being implemented.

- add delcom command class
- add delcom parser
- add delcom to ab parser

Test cases are failing as they may not have customers.

This is a hacky fix for filteredCommissions - not used currently, but
may be necessary when search is used in the future.

When it is used, it will need significant changes, because unlike a
person list that is always the same source list, this is not true for
commissions.

commitResults.messageTitle: Model: clone activeCustomer to force GUI update
commitResults.messageBody:
The GUI is not updating when UniqueCustomerList is updated.

This is likely because a new Person object is necessary for the
list to detect changes. EditCommand seems to already do that.

Let's implement methods to shallow clone Person objects and clone
activeCustomer when deleting commissions to force GUI updates.

commitResults.messageTitle: Model: add completion status to commission
Model: move activeCustomer from AddressBook to ModelManager
commitResults.messageBody:
AddressBook stores activeCustomer and has commission methods that assume
activeCustomer's UniqueCustomerList is the target list.

Let's add the customer parameter to AddressBook commission methods and
move activeCustomer to ModelManager to make AddressBook easier to test
in the future.

commitResults.messageTitle: Model: add combined commission list to AddressBook
commitResults.messageBody:
BREAKING CHANGE: Names for commissions must now be unique across all
persons. I am not yet sure if this is a bug or a feature.

Commission lists are currently by customer only.

Let's create a combined commission list in AddressBook, where changes
across all lists are propagated to it.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix: keep same selectedCustomer when deleting commissions
commitResults.messageBody:
It is jumping to the first customer because equality check fails as
when customer updates, a new instance is created.

Let's use Customer::isSameCustomer to fix this problem.

- refactor names in TypicalIndex to not be customer specific to reuse

The reason why I am not using assertCommandSuccess is because if I copy
the delcus tests to create an expectedModel, both model and
expectedModel have the same Customer objects, and deleting one
commission will also modify the other model.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix: update customer pane when editing customer
commitResults.messageBody:
The change in selectCustomer is necessary because isSameCustomer can
still return true even if the customer is edited.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix: stop invalid data from crashing the app
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the CommissionListPanel does not check if
observableCommissionList is null (unlike
ModelManager#getFilteredCommissionList, that does.)

Invalid data will force an empty addressbook - making the
observableCommissionList null and causing a NullPointerException on
running the app.

Let's add a null check to fix this.

commitResults.messageTitle: Model: remove customer from commission equality check
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, customer's equality check checks if the commissions are the
same and the commission equality check checks if the customer are the
same, leading to an infinite loop.

Let's remove one of the checks.

loading it as a resource.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add a NullableAddress class to support an EmptyAddress type.
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the `add` command does not support an optional address field, tags can be optional since it is implemented in the form of a `Set`.

This change is necessary since our specification requires Address to be an optional field. Introducing the NullableAddress and EmptyAddress class allows the user to avoid specifying the customer's address when calling the `addcus` command.

Since any address input by the user must be non-empty, the EmptyAddress can be stored as the empty string within the JSON storage file without any conflicts with any Address instances, and no changes to the storage representation is necessary.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add basic GUI pane to show current selected Customer - Just a baseline for us to work with. - Added an ObservableObject class that works the same way as ObservableList so we can display the current selected Customer. - Add TabPane for GUI to switch between Customers and Commissions, (currently Commissions disabled) - Add SplitPane for Customer tab to show list and current customer.
Fix bug for old customer pane tags not being cleared

commitResults.messageBody: Unit test selectCustomer and getSelectedCustomer

commitResults.messageTitle: Move commission related methods to Customer model
commitResults.messageBody:
Allows us to avoid keeping track of the customer we are performing any commission operations on. We can implement a method within AddressBook to get a FilteredList of all commissions across all customers, but for customer specific commission operations, we can just put those under the Customer model.

Undo previous change from `UniqueCommissionList` to `Set<Commission>` in 85d2361

- The previous suggestion that led to the commit was made with the idea that we would need to change the customer's hash to trigger the UI rerender, but by directly passing this list into the UI, this avoids the issue of the UI not re-rendering.
- We can also simply make use of the add/set/delete operations under the UniqueCommissionList which makes things easier.

commitResults.messageTitle: Make the commission list in `ModelManager` observable
commitResults.messageBody:
Links the existing commission list to the selected customer, and makes it easier to update the list without having to manually update the filtered list everytime the customer changes or gets updated.

Update `DeleteCommissionCommand` to apply changes on list within selected customer

Add listener to observable commission in CommissionListPanel

- triggers update of UI when selected customer changes or when the commission list of the customer changes.

Make full commission list separate from the customer's commission lists

- add a method to get the full commission list that is only called when no customers are selected.

Update tests based on updates in master
commitResults.messageBody:
Enforce non-null customer within commissions

- Previously customer could be `null` due to implementation of `JsonAdaptedCustomer` requiring the customer to be set after the instance was created.
- To avoid null pointer exceptions and since all commissions has customers, the Customer field for all commissions must be non-null.

Modify AddCommissionCommand to return the customer builder instead of the customer, since the selected customer is only known when `execute` is called.
- Note that the result displayed when performing any commission commands now prints the CommissionBuilder (without the customer) instead of the entire Commission

- listener only triggers on subsequent changes
- use `setOnMousePressed` to avoid repeated handlers

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix issue where removing a customer or commission from list does not update the display
Wrap observableCommissionsList in a Pair with customer
commitResults.messageBody: - Rationale: There is an issue where two identical UniqueCommissionLists for different customers would have the same hash, and switching between customers with identical lists would not trigger the change listener for the observableFilteredCommissions.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove unnecessary method call since commissions is initialized by default
Modify logic for which customer/commission to select
commitResults.messageBody:
- After delete, switch selection only if currently selected item is deleted.
- After addition, select the newly added item

Wrap FilteredList in SortedList to be passed into UI.

Currently only supports a single comparator. Supporting multiple comparators would need a way to identify the order of arguments being parsed by the user.

How this sorting is implemented:
- user would enter `sortcus n/+` to sort in increasing order based on the customer's name.
- We can specify more comparators within `Model.java`

Implement SortCustomerCommand

Move `arePrefixesPresent` to ParserUtil to avoid duplication

commitResults.messageTitle: Add sort comparison by last commission date
Replace `ImagePath` with `Path` for more robust handling of cases
commitResults.messageBody:
Add methods within ImageStorage to save and load BufferedImage from disk

Instead of just copying the image after checking for the image type, try to read the image using the image readers present in the system, and throw an error.
- This handles the issue with certain image extensions e.g. webp not being directly supported by JavaFX.

Remove file storage checking from ParserUtil and handle that within the `execute` method instead.

Move the hardcoded image directory into the yaml config.

Handle more invalid image path or image exceptions.

commitResults.messageBody:

Instead of just copying the image after checking for the image type, try to read the image using the image readers present in the system, and throw an error.
- This handles the issue with certain image extensions e.g. webp not being directly supported by JavaFX.

Remove file storage checking from ParserUtil and handle that within the `execute` method instead.
